newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: REED ELSEVIER HAS 96 PCT OF MDL.
newsitem.headline: REED ELSEVIER HAS 96 PCT OF MDL.

text.p: Anglo-Dutch publisher Reed Elsevier said on Friday it had successfully concluded its tender offer for MDL Information Systems in the U.S.

"Based on a preliminary count, approximately 8.5 million shares of MDL's common stock, representing approximately 96 percent of MDL's outstanding shares, were tendered," Reed Elsevier said in a statement.

MDL will be merged with Reed Elsevier's subsidiary Golden Gate Acquisition Corp. All MDL shares not tendered will be converted into the right to receive $32 in cash, the same amount Reed Elsevier offered per MDL share.
MDL Information Systems supplies scientific information management systems. It posted a pre-tax profit of $11 million in the year to March 31, 1996, on revenues of $62 million.
Reed Elsevier said in March, when it first announced the public bid for MDL, it would use part of its cash balance of over one billion sterling to finance the transaction.
